page.title: 04CLUBS AT HAMPTON, HERNE BAY
page.content: Although this is mainly a residential area there are also some buildings more connected with recreation. A line of wooden beach huts face the sea at the bottom of the grassey slope from the road. Just behind these are the buildings used by the Sea Cadets, the Rowing Club and the Hampton Pier Yachting Club. The Sea Cadets takes boys from the age of 11 and gives them some training in nautical skills. Some of these boys go on to join the Navy when they are older. The Rowing Club is a popular place for a drink and it holds many social functions. The rowing crews are quite strong and compete in regattas around the coast as far as Dorset. The Hampton Pier Yacht Club is not as large as the Sailing Club at the eastern end of the Town but it has a modern clubhouse and is very busy at week ends in summer.
